alert.note: Alert for Clark; Garland; Hot Spring; Montgomery; Pike (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 09 at 1:09AM CST by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Clark, eastern Pike, southwestern Garland, west central Hot Spring and southeastern Montgomery Counties through 145 AM CST... At 109 AM CST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles east of Murfreesboro, moving northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Amity... Meyers... Lofton... DeGray Lake State Park... Delight... Bismarck... Alpine... Bonnerdale... Welsh... Sunshine... Shawmut... Rosboro... Pike City... De Roche... Point Cedar... Pettyview... Hempwallace... Pearcy... Crystal Springs... Royal... MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
